intro: Herniaria scabrida var. unamunoana, commonly known as the rough herniaria, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within its native habitat.
